page.title: 06HISTORIC BUILDINGS
page.content: There are many old churches in Kendal The oldest is the{Parish Church.}The oldest part was built in{1201.}The church has a lectern and pulpit which date from{1800.}It has a font dating from{1400.}It has four chapels, the oldest two dating from{1300.}It has 11 different{stained glass windows}and it is the second widest church in England In Kendal 1/4 of the houses are old, i.e. over 50 years. The old houses are made from{Lakeland Limestone}with small windows and are in small alleys, whereas the new houses are built on spacious housing estates. Many of the old buildings have new uses eg.{Abbot Hall}is now an award winning museum.{The Castle Dairy}is now a restaurant.Some of the old buildings have been converted into shops and some of them are kept as houses.
